column4: can you please explain me why if Ubuntu Karmic uses PulseAudio, all the guides/howto tell you to configure the alsa-base.conf ?! How ALSA is related to PulseAudio?!
pulseaudio works on top of alsa audio drivers
since Pulse is giving me a lot of problems, in particular applications lock the audio among themselves... is there a way to fix it or to use only ALSA?
that's becouse maybe the apps areot configured to use pulseaudio ?
I try to re-formulate.... are you aware of all those PulseAudio problems?
if the apps are configured to use oss or alsa directly they can block other apps from using the card
not that i ask much from it.
ok, this is a reasonable answer... let's try to understand better...
do you know if wine applications use alsa directly or if they use pulse?
just make sure that all apps that can be configured on how to use audio are configured to use pulseaudio; esd or alsa
you can use winecfg to choose what to use. i use ESD

I mainly use three applications: a windows game that I start with wine (for this reason I'm asking if wine uses alsa directly or if it uses pulse), Firefox+flash plugin (to watch some videos on youtube) and Vagalume, a last.fm client written for Gnome
vlc has a pulseaudio plugin. in gstreamer-properties you can configure apps that use gstreamer (like totem; RB or banshee) etc...
for wine do what i said. flash should be compatible with pulse by default; for vagalume (firefly) use gstreamer-properties
gstreamer-properties let me configure the default audio server for all applications... do I set PulseAudio or do I leave "Default" ?
default or pulse should work. try changinfg to pulse given that current conf gives you problems
